# Recipe: Oven Baked Ziti

## Introduction
Oven Baked Ziti is a classic Italian-American dish that combines pasta, tomato sauce, cheese, and herbs. It is a comforting and hearty dish that is perfect for family dinners or gatherings. The ziti pasta is cooked until al dente, then layered with a rich tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese, and Parmesan cheese. The dish is then baked in the oven until the cheese is melted and bubbly. This recipe is a crowd-pleaser and is sure to become a favorite in your household.

## Ingredients
- 1 pound (450g) ziti pasta
- 2 cups (480ml) marinara sauce
- 2 cups (480ml) shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1/2 cup (50g) grated Parmesan cheese
- 1/4 cup (15g) chopped fresh basil
- 1/4 cup (15g) chopped fresh parsley
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper

## Equipment
- Large pot for boiling pasta
- 9x13-inch baking dish
- Mixing bowl
- Wooden spoon or spatula
- Aluminum foil

## Preparation Time
- 10 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 30 minutes

## Steps
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the ziti pasta according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta and set aside.
3. In a mixing bowl, combine the marinara sauce, chopped basil, chopped parsley, salt, and black pepper. Mix well.
4. In the baking dish, spread a thin layer of the marinara sauce mixture on the bottom.
5. Add half of the cooked ziti pasta on top of the sauce.
6. Pour half of the remaining marinara sauce over the pasta and spread it evenly.
7. Sprinkle half of the mozzarella cheese and half of the Parmesan cheese over the sauce.
8. Repeat the layers with the remaining ziti pasta, marinara sauce, mozzarella cheese, and Parmesan cheese.
9. Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.
10. Remove the foil and bake for an additional 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. Remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

## Serving Suggestions
- Serve the Oven Baked Ziti as a main course with a side of garlic bread and a green salad.
- Pair it with a glass of red wine for a complete Italian-inspired meal.

## Variations
- Add cooked ground beef, Italian sausage, or shredded chicken to the sauce for a meaty version.
- Mix in sautéed vegetables such as bell peppers, onions, and mushrooms for added flavor and nutrition.
- Experiment with different types of cheese, such as ricotta or fontina, for a unique twist.

## Tips and Tricks
- Be sure to cook the pasta until al dente, as it will continue to cook in the oven.
- Use a good quality marinara sauce or make your own for the best flavor.
- For a crispy top, broil the dish for a few minutes after baking.
- Leftovers can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

## Nutritional Information
- Serving Size: 1 cup
- Calories: 350
- Total Fat: 12g
- Saturated Fat: 6g
- Cholesterol: 30mg
- Sodium: 600mg
- Carbohydrates: 43g
- Fiber: 3g
- Sugar: 5g
- Protein: 17g

## Storage and Leftovers
- Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
- To reheat, cover the dish with foil and bake in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) until heated through.

## Frequently Asked Questions
Q: Can I make this dish ahead of time?
A: Yes, you can assemble the dish ahead of time and refrigerate it until ready to bake. Just be sure to adjust the baking time accordingly.

Q: Can I freeze the leftovers?
A: Yes, you can freeze the leftovers in an airtight container for up to 3 months. Thaw in the refrigerator before reheating.

Q: Can I use a different type of pasta?
A: Yes, you can use other tube-shaped pasta such as penne or rigatoni instead of ziti. Adjust the cooking time accordingly.
